title: Question 9
prompt: Choose the answer that is written correctly and shows the correct capitalization and punctuation.  Be sure the answer you choose is complete.
feedback: The word "you're" is a contraction for ''you are.'' The word "your'' shows that something belongs to you or is related to you (for example, your job, your sister, or your house).  In this case, it is proper English to use the word "your" when referring to the garbage and the house, since they belong to you. The choice “If you leave your garbage out at night the bears will be attracted to your house” uses the word “your” correctly but needs a comma after the dependent clause “If you leave your garbage out at night.”
